newsitem.title: USA: Bay Networks sees Q1 revs above estimates.
newsitem.headline: Bay Networks sees Q1 revs above estimates.

text.p: Bay Networks Inc said Tuesday it expected its revenues in the first quarter ending September 26 to top analysts' estimates amidst strong demand for its products.
"Based on bookings for the first seven weeks of the first fiscal quarter ... revenue for the quarter is likely to exceed consensus market expectations," a company statement said.
It added it expected to record more than half of the quarter's revenue in the remaining six weeks of the period, based on historical seasonal trends.
A company spokeswoman was not immediately available to say what Bay networks sees as the market consensus for its first-quarter revenues.
A July 22 First Call poll of 26 analysts put the company's earnings at $0.16 a share for the first quarter ending September 26.
Bay Networks offers frame and ATM swtiches, routers, remote and Internet access solutions, and network management applications.
